modName: Tundra Tree and Drift wood Retexture - Gildergreen Edition
summary: This mod provides nearly a full customization of the Tundra Tree including Glidergreen retexture. IT WILL CHANGE DRIFT WOOD!!!
descriptionHtml:
[size=3][center][color=#ff0000][size=6][b][/b][/size][/color][/center][/size][center][size=3][color=#ff0000][size=6][b]DO NOT INSTALL WITH MOD MANAGERS
ALL TEXTURES MUST BE MANUALLY INSTALLED!!!!![/b][/size]
[/color]
(I don't know how to make them manager compatible either)[/size]
[size=3](don't be silly and think the game will install/transition automatically)

[color=#ffff00][size=6][b]UPDATE 2/22/2018 TO THOSE WHO HAVE ALREADY DOWNLOADED:[/b][/size][/color]
[color=#ffff00]A little birdy told me, that if you use any of the branch options before you complete the quest 'The Blessings of Nature'Â  the Gildergreen will use them.
[size=3][color=#ffff00]Read the 'Suggestions' tab down below if you want to avoid [i]this[/i] issue.[/color][/size]
Some of the Reach and Sleeping tree branches will also be affected in the same manner. Sadly, this is unavoidable.[/color][/size][/center][size=3][color=#ffff00]
[/color]
[size=4][b][size=5]Reminder[/size]
SUBMIT YOUR PIC'S!!!![/b][/size]

[size=5][b]Description[/b][/size]
This mod provides nearly a full customization of the Tundra Tree including Glidergreen retexture. THIS WILL CHANGE DRIFT WOOD!!! It will also make 'The Blessings of Nature' quest feel less immersive or more immersive depending on your idea of what makes something "Immersive".

[size=5][b]Why?[/b][/size]
I've been fiddling around with textures recently making the weirdest things for fun. I was looking for a new muse and there it was the dead tundra tree. Thought of the Gildergreen's textures and here we are.

[size=5][b]Options and Folder Directories[/b][/size]
Before quest:
Dead bark- gives the dead tundra tree the dead Gildergreen's bark before the quest 'The Blessings of Nature' is completed.
Only Blank texture- no branches or roots
Only Branches- contains vanilla texture of branches with no roots
Only roots- contains vanilla texture of roots with no branches

After quest:
Alive bark- gives the dead tundra tree the alive Gildergreen's bark after the quest 'The Blessings of Nature' is completed.
NoRoots- you will have Gildergreen branches. You won't have any roots growing out of the bottom of fallen over trees.
Normal roots- vanilla root texture with Gildergreen branches
Gildergreen branch Roots- you will have Gildergreen branches growing out of the bottom of fallen over trees.
[b][size=5]
READ THE 'Readme.txt' FOR INSTALLATION OPTIONS[/size][/b]

[b][size=5]Installation:[/size][/b]
Pick and choose from the folders given.
Go to your Skyrim folder. Should be located under your C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam\steamapps\common\Skyrim
Or in steam right click on The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim, click properties, click local files tab, then click Browse Local Files.
Take the data(s) folders chosen and drop them in.
Merge when prompted.
Replace if asked.

[size=3][size=3][size=5][b]Future Plans[/b][/size]
Give these retextures a lore friendly explanation. Make more options and recolor everything.
I might add some of my other retextures to this mod as options.
Make 4k textures of the branches and possibly the roots.

[size=5][b]Suggestions[/b][/size]
Before you start the quest 'The Blessings of Nature' use the Dead bark option.
After you start the quest 'The Blessings of Nature' use the Alive bark option.
I also HIGHLY suggest using the 'Gildergreen branch Roots' option as it
will look and feel like the Gildergreen has suddenly been brought back
too life.[/size][/size]

[b][size=5]Uninstall:[/size][/b]
tundradriftwoodbark01.dds
tundradriftwoodbark01_n.dds
tundradriftwoodbranches01.dds

[size=5][b]Permissions[/b][/size]
The textures are Bethesda's and so I claim no right to them. I do however claim the right to the thought and idea put into this mod.
Share your screenie's with me!!!!

[size=5][b]Credit/Programs Used[/b][/size]
Bethesda- for the texture's
GIMP
Brain.exe





[/size]
author: Rimheirts
